intro: Caulokaempferia suksathanii, commonly known as the Thai ginger orchid, is a rare and endemic orchid species native to Thailand. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae and is characterized by its striking, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant has fleshy, strap-like leaves and produces inflorescences with numerous small, clustered flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions with well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
